author: Bayne Hughes Staff Writer
title: City officials go to Washington seeking bridge study funding
text: A trip to Washington, D.C., this week didn’t yield immediate results, but Decatur Mayor Tab Bowling said he returned with optimism about getting money for the second phase of a study for a new Tennessee River bridge. Bowling, City Councilman Carlton McMasters and city Chief Financial Officer Kyle Demeester met Monday with U.S. Sen. Tommy Tuberville, Rep. Dale Strong, R-Huntsville, and their staffs. U.S. Sen. Katie Britt was absent, but her chief of staff, Clay Armentrout, and her legislative director, Dan Hillenbrand, did attend. It was a quick, 24-hour trip for the trio. Demeester said funds for the lobbying trip came from the mayor’s budget for conventions and seminars. The main topic they wanted to discuss with Alabama's congressional delegation was funding for a second study on a third bridge over the Tennessee River. TTL Inc., along with Pugh Wright McAnally and Jacobs Engineering, completed an initial study that determined the region needs a new bridge because of heavy traffic congestion on U.S. 31 and the Hudson Memorial Bridge. The next phase would include environmental fieldwork, a more extensive traffic study and selection of the most effective bridge location. Engineers could then begin design, engineering, right-of-way acquisition and construction. Dewayne Hellums, Decatur-area Metropolitan Planning Organization director, said Thursday that MPO needs $4 million to $5 million for the second phase. “We’re done with the first phase, and the council approved it in April,” Hellums said. “Now we’re waiting to find out when the second phase is a go.” Decatur paid $1 million and also received a $1 million federal grant from the Appalachian Regional Commission for the first phase. “We’re going after federal and state money for the second phase,” Hellums said. McMasters said the congressional delegation “is keenly aware we need some money for a bridge, and they are very supportive of it.” He said the delegation knows Decatur is getting an inland port. In March, the city found out it is getting a Port Authority inland rail facility that will transfer shipping containers between rail and trucks. Expected to be ready in 2025, the facility will help goods from Mobile reach the rest of the state. “The port could bring more traffic,” McMasters said. “We’re trying to get ahead of this issue, and a bridge is a big part of our needs.” Bowling said Tuberville recently said there’s a need for additional infrastructure in the region. “That includes the need for a river bridge,” Bowling said. “This is a project that will impact the whole region, not just Decatur. They want to help us.” Congress is in session now and is working on appropriations and the fiscal 2026 budget. “We want to be optimistic but, if you watch the news, you know these are some very challenging times right now in Washington,” Bowling said. Bowling said it would be sometime in 2025 before they know and then receive any federal funding. For example, he said it was March before Pryor Field Regional Airport received $3.2 million for the first phase of a southeast taxiway.

author: Passant Rabie
title: The ISS Is Leaking Air—And NASA and Russia Can’t Agree Why
text: For the past five years, air has been escaping through a Russian section of the International Space Station (ISS) at an increasing rate. NASA and its Russian counterpart, Roscosmos, are still in disagreement over the root cause of the leak, as well as the severity of the consequences.The leak was first discovered in 2019 in the vestibule (named PrK) that connects a docking port to the Russian Zvezda module, which Roscosmos had launched to low Earth orbit in July 2000. Earlier this year, NASA elevated the leak to the highest level of risk as the rate of air escaping from the module had doubled from one pound of air per day to a little over two pounds. The Air Leak on ISS Russian Module Is Getting Worse “While the Russian team continues to search for and seal the leaks, it does not believe catastrophic disintegration of the PrK is realistic,â€� Bob Cabana, a former NASA astronaut who now chairs the ISS Advisory Committee, said during a meeting on Wednesday, SpaceNews reported . “NASA has expressed concerns about the structural integrity of the PrK and the possibility of a catastrophic failure.”â€œThe Russians believe that continued operations are safe but they canâ€™t prove to our satisfaction that they are, and the U.S. believes that itâ€™s not safe but we canâ€™t prove to the Russiansâ€™ satisfaction that thatâ€™s the case,â€� he added.Russian teams believe the air leak was likely caused by high cyclic fatigue from micro vibrations, while teams at NASA think pressure and mechanical stress, residual stress, material properties of the module, and environmental exposure are all at play, according to SpaceNews.The air leak was addressed in a recent report by NASA’s Office of Inspector General (OIG), which highlighted its true severity and the risk it poses to the crew. The OIG report stated that the two space agencies canâ€™t seem to agree on the point at which the leak should be considered unsustainable. NASA and Roscosmos met to discuss the ISS air leak, with NASA officials noting that Roscosmos â€œis confident they will be able to monitor and close the hatch to the Service Module prior to the leak rate reaching an untenable level,â€� according to the report.â€œAlthough the teams continue to investigate the causal factors for the crack initiation and growth, the U.S. and Russian technical teams donâ€™t have a common understanding of what the likely root cause is or the severity of the consequences of these leaks,” Cabana is quoted in SpaceNews as saying.The rate of air leaking from the hole increased around a week before the February 14 launch of the Progress MS-26 cargo spacecraft, which docked to the aft end of Zvezda. The hatch that connects the module to the ISS remained open for five days as the crew offloaded the cargo from Progress MS-26 onto the space station, but was closed shut afterwards.NASA and Roscosmos are currently monitoring the leak and preparing to close the hatch to the service module when access is not required in order to minimize the amount of air lost and isolate the leak itself from the rest of the space station. If required, the space agencies are prepared to permanently shut off the hatch should the leak rate became unmanageable. The ISS would function normally, but there would be one less docking port for spacecraft delivering cargo to the space station.As the two space agencies continue to discuss the potential risk, the aging space station is inching closer to retirement within the next six years and its hardware may finally be giving in to the wear and tear of the harsh space environment.

author: Por Alejandro Paez
title: SNTE y CNDH impulsan la Cultura de Paz en escuelas mexicanas – La Crónica de Hoy México
text:
Alfonso Cepeda Salas, líder del SNTE, señala que la Cultura de Paz es fundamental para transformar las escuelas en espacios de respeto, inclusión y convivencia pacífica — En un esfuerzo conjunto por promover la [Cultura de Paz](https://snte.org.mx/cultura-paz/), el Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores de la Educación (SNTE) y la Comisión Nacional de los Derechos Humanos (CNDH) entregaron reconocimientos a los ganadores del Concurso de Dibujo [“Convivencia Escolar Pacífica”](https://snte.org.mx/cultura-paz/).
En este certamen nacional participaron más de 2 mil 200 estudiantes de tercer año de secundaria, quienes resaltaron el compromiso educativo con la [Cultura de Paz](https://snte.org.mx/cultura-paz/) en México.
Los tres primeros lugares fueron otorgados a Ximena Andrea Fuentes Cima de Quintana Roo, con su dibujo titulado “Un mundo sin violencia”; Ricardo García García de Tabasco, que elaboró “El Mundo es para Todos” y Frida Alejandra Loera Campos de Jalisco, por “Zapotlatena”.
Alfonso Cepeda Salas, secretario general del SNTE, resaltó la importancia de la campaña [¡Ármate de valor por una Cultura de Paz!](https://snte.org.mx/cultura-paz/), que fomenta relaciones respetuosas y reflexivas en las escuelas.
“La población debe saber que las escuelas públicas en México están colocando lienzos blancos que identifican su participación a favor de la Cultura de Paz”, explicó.
Añadió que las comunidades escolares se movilizan para reflexionar y analizar el tema, registrar proyectos de construcción colectiva, elaborar propuestas, tomar acciones y establecer compromisos firmes con esta agenda”.
Estudiantes se interesan por Cultura de Paz
En esta tercera edición, la participación aumentó por el interés creciente de los estudiantes por temas como la inclusión, la diversidad y el respeto.
El Maestro dirigente expresó que en 2024 el 61.6 por ciento de los participantes fueron alumnas.
Dijo que “desde nuestro campo de trabajo estamos decididos a seguir contribuyendo con el Segundo Piso de la Cuarta Transformación para, juntos, forjar un mejor país”.
Por su parte Norma Angélica Molina Padilla, de la CNDH, dijo que los dibujos visibilizan temas fundamentales como el bullying, Personas con Discapacidad, lengua de señas, y los derechos de comunidades indígenas.
La exposición virtual de los dibujos estará disponible en las plataformas del SNTE y la CNDH, para consolidar y difundir el impacto de esta iniciativa que “refuerza la formación integral en valores y la construcción de una sociedad más justa y pacífica”, dijo Cepeda Salas.
SNTE y CNDH impulsan la Cultura de Paz en escuelas mexicanas

author: diariopopular
title: Barcelona le ganó al Barbastro y sacó el boleto a octavos
text:
El Culé se quedó con la victoria ante el Barbastro y sigue en pie en la Copa del Rey. Sevilla, en un duelo lleno de argentinos, también pasó de fase.
Por los 16vos de final de la Copa del Rey, Barcelona le ganó 3 a 2 Barbastro, club de la Segunda División de España. Los de Xavi fueron eficaces aunque no le sobraron nada. Sufrieron hasta lo último a pesar de siempre ir arriba en el resultado.
ADEMÁS: La millonaria cifra que Diego Martínez le pagó a Huracán para ir a Boca En el Campo Municipal de Deportes, estadio donde el Barbastro hace de local, el Azulgrana tenía una misión: pasar de ronda. Iba a empezar arriba en el marcador tras un centro de Raphinha y la llegada de Fermín López que la empujó cerca del área chica para marcar el 1 a 0.
El segundo iba a llegar en el complemento, una de las promesas que tiene el Culé, Hector Fort, enganchó de izquierda a derecha y metió un centro al segundo palo en donde Raphinha se coló y puso el 2 a 0.
Cerca de la hora de juego, llegó el de descuento luego de un tiro de esquina, un rebote que quedó boyando y Adrià De Mesa aprovechó . El Barbastro se ilusionaba.
Cuando parecía que se terminaba el partido, todavía faltaba acción. Un centro al área, Robert Lewandowski cabeceó y pegó en la mano de un defensor rival. El propio Lewandowski marcó el tercero de penal.
Sobre el descuento , Fermín López cometió un penal y Marc Prat puso el 3 a 2 final . Los de Xavi se metieron en la siguiente instancia.
Embed Sevilla le ganó a Racing Ferrol y sonrió después de tiempo Tras el mal andar en La Liga, Sevilla le ganó de visitante 2 a 1 a Racing Ferrol y avanzó de fase. Lucas Ocampos fue titular y Marcos Acuña y Federico Gattoni estuvieron en el banco de suplentes pero no vieron minutos. El arquero Gianfranco Gazzaniga también salió desde el inicio en el equipo local.
Los sevillanos llegaron al gol luego de un tiro de esquina y el rebote que capturó Marcão para hacer el primer gol. Los de Enrique Sánchez Flores que tiene un mal pasar en el torneo, debían casi de forma obligada vencer a Racing Ferrol, que juega en la Segunda División de España.
El empate iba a llegar bajo la famosa frase "dos cabezazos en el área es gol" y Fran Manzanara empató el partido en su llegada por el segundo palo. A los minutos, el propio Manzanara iba a ver la segunda tarjeta amarilla y se fue expulsado.
Desde allí, Sevilla tomó las riendas del partido y puso al rival contra un arco. La visita le sacaba provecho a la superioridad numérica e iba a ganar el partido sobre el final.
ADEMÁS: Rollheiser se va al Benfica: una millonada para Estudiantes A los 87 minutos, en centro que pasó por todo el área rival y Juanlu Sánchez llegó solo por el segundo palo que se tomó dos tiempos: controló y remató, Gazzaniga casi le saca el gol, la tapó pero la pelota se terminó metiendo. Sevilla ganó y consiguió el pase a octavos.
El resto de los resultados:
Amorebieta 2-4 Celta de Vigo
Burgos CF 0-3 Mallorca
Castellón 0-1 Osasuna
Eibar 0-3 Athletic Bilbao
Cartagena 1-2 Valencia
Unionistas 1-1 Villarreal (suspendido por corte de luz en el tiempo extra )
Málaga 0-1 Real Sociedad
Tenerife 2-0 Las Palmas
Videos relacionados: Aparecen en esta nota: Barcelona Copa del Rey

author: Lorenzo Marquez
title: Hilary Swank and Alan Ritchson at the ORDINARY ANGELS New York Premiere
text:
Hilary Swank and Alan Ritchson hit the red carpet for their cheesy little religion flick.
They look like two complete strangers heading to two different events who were inexplicably asked to pose with each other on the way.
HILARY SWANK IN VIVIENNE WESTWOOD
We’ve seen this dress a million times before and even a casual fashion observer can peg it as a Westwood on sight. Still, that’s no complaint; not when the dress suits her so well. She looks great in it, but we wonder if she’s not the one who missed the vibe of the event by getting so formal.
ALAN RITCHSON
Orange Hulk. We get that he had to bulk up tremendously for the Reacher series, which is basically about a guy who solves problems by being really, really big, but we thought he looked better without about 40 fewer pounds of muscle on him. Having said that, his clothes are nicely fitted, if somewhat casual. Given the nature of this film, he’s avoiding getting too fancy in his style choices. They’re fine. But good God, that’s a lot of bronzer.
Style Credits:
Vivienne Westwood Off-the-shoulder Dress | Fred Leighton Jewelry | Manolo Blahnik Shoes
Hilary Swank
Styled by Thomas Carter Phillips | Hair by DJ Quintero | Makeup by Fabiola
ABOUT THE MOVIE:
– Based on a remarkable true story, ORDINARY ANGELS centers on Sharon Stevens (Hilary Swank), a fierce but struggling hairdresser in small-town Kentucky who discovers a renewed sense of purpose when she meets Ed Schmitt (Alan Ritchson), a widower working hard to make ends meet for his two daughters. With his youngest daughter waiting for a liver transplant, Sharon sets her mind to helping the family and will move mountains to do it. What unfolds is the inspiring tale of faith, everyday miracles, and ordinary angels.
– Starring Hilary Swank, Alan Ritchson, Nancy Travis, Tamala Jones, and Amy Acker.
– Only in theaters February 23, 2024.
[Photo Credit: Marion Curtis/StarPix for for Lionsgate/INSTARimages – Video Credit: Lionsgate Movies/YouTube]

author: 中國報
title: 听障少女左耳听力退化 盼完整听见世界 | 中國報 China Press
text:
（大山脚3日讯）22岁听障少女曾于3年前在右耳植入人造耳蜗，然而如今就连左耳也严重退化，能够完整听见世界已变成她最大的奢求！
来自霹雳金宝的陈嘉棋，向大山脚瑶池金母慈善基金会（One Hope Charity）求助，经该会募款已筹足所不敷的4万4800令吉耳蜗费，另2万令吉费用由其养母承担。
该会主席拿督蔡瑞豪昨日发文告说，嘉棋出生后就被亲生父母遗弃，由一名善心女士黄顺昌收养，自小在关爱中成长，但她3岁时仍无法说话，幼儿园老师发现异常，经诊断证实为双耳失聪。
“因养母不懂得正式收养程序，嘉棋在12岁申请身分证时被列为无国籍孩童，所幸在我们协助下顺利获得公民权，并在中学毕业后，经由老师协助成功申领残疾人士卡。”
他说，该会3年前曾协助嘉棋进行右耳人造耳蜗植入手术后，努力赶上学业，完成中学考入一所烘焙学院。
“目前她在怡保一家面包店实习，仅靠右耳接收声音，无法听见左边或身后声音，以及分辨声音来源方向。”
他透露，嘉棋在完成实习前，曾两度被雇主以“听力影响工作效率”为由，中止实习安排，让少女一度感到自卑与沮丧。
“所幸，目前第3家实习单位给予她机会，而医生也在近期复诊时指出，其左耳听力持续退化，现有助听器已无法提供足够辅助，必须尽快进行耳蜗植入手术。”
养母黄顺昌（59岁）靠在家制作糕点售卖为生，每月仅有千多令吉收入，母女俩相依为命。
中国报官方WhatsApp平台！
https://t.me/chinapressonline

author: lib_free
title: #19 El mayor sindicato argentino convoca una huelga general en enero por la polémica ley ómnibus de Milei
text:
[ElenaTripillas](/user/ElenaTripillas)a [infolibre.es](/go/link/3891566) [#8](c8#c-8) Entonces los derechos que sean solo para los que están afiliados a esos sindicatos, ¿no? O derechos si, pero lucha pasamos de follones ¿verdad?
[#11](c11#c-11) los derechos son para todos. Yo no quiero pagar parasitos...si tu quieres pagalos de tu esfuerzo y tu bolsillo, lo mismo para la iglesia o la monarquia, quien quiera que pague de su bolsillo y no del bolsillo ajeno
[#13](c13#c-13) Vamos que los derechos caen del cielo por desearlos muy fuerte. Pues nada, ya sabes cuando te dejen de pagar a protestar en tu casa llorando bajito, no sea que hagas ruido...
[#16](c16#c-16) cuando me dejen de pagar el alquiler y tenga que hacer frente a los destrozos, los impuestos, las tasas, las reformas y el desalojo privado porque la justicia es un chiste y nadie defiende tus derechos a pesar de tener una de las administraciones mas voraz e ineficiente de la historia.... yo para que me roben y me den de palos no pago dinero eso lo dejo para los masoquistas.
[#17](c17#c-17) Hala hala ya paso, tscchh ya paso, ya paso... Por cierto el cuento del rentista a otro, repasa mis comentarios recientes.
Cuando a tus inquilinos les dejen de pagar y no puedan reclamar a ningún lado, porque Miley les ha quitado esa opción, cuando no tengan a nadie que les ayude porque el estado ya no ayuda, ya me contaras a quien vas a reclamar tu el alquiler ya.
O mejor aun, cuando te veas obligado a cobrar en judías pintas, como ha liberalizado Miley, ya veras que risas nos pegamos.
[#18](c18#c-18) es que me estas contando un cuento de hadas....parece que ignoras que el populismo de izqdas ha llevado a la pobreza al 50% de la población, un 10% a la indigencia y la inflación es del 120%....eso se llama esclavitud a penas llega para comer... en fin éa distorsion de la realidad que veo en meneame es brutal.
Me parece perfecto que si tu llegas a un acuerdo para cobrar en divisas, en acciones o en materias primas puedas hacerlo...que problema hay? estamos de acuerdo que hoy en dia el talento no quiere cobrar en pesos argentinos...pues eso estupendo
[#19](c19#c-19) La izquierda socialdemócrata también es la que ha llevado a Europa a la mayor época de prosperidad en su historia... El mejunje comunocapitalista de economía abierta pero planificada de China le ha llevado a ser la segunda economía del mundo.
Así que eso de decir tan alegremente que la izquierda hunde en la pobreza...
Por supuesto, esta de pm poder cambiar un alquiler por judías. Ya me lo contaras ya.
[#13](c13#c-13) Año 1987. Juan, tornero fresador de Reinosa, participa en las huelgas obreras contra el cierre de su fábrica y la reconversión industrial. La huelga le cuesta la vida a un compañero suyo por disparos de guardia civil.
Año 2012. Manolo, minero asturiano, participa en una marcha hasta Madrid para defender su puesto de trabajo y el pan de su familia en una zona sin otra alternativa laboral que la actividad minera.
Año 2023. Juan y Manolo ya jubilados, uno con dos dedos de la mano amputados y el otro con los pulmones hechos mierda tienen que leer en meneame como un indocumentado les llama parásitos.
Estan que se corren los liberatas con lo de la prohibición a manifestarse en Argentina... Libertad para ellos, los que tienen, para hacer a su antojo. El resto, libertad para morirse de asco y elegir el modelo de cadena y grillete...
Que ascazo.
Unos garcas, tantos años vivendo del cuento, la idiosincracia de aquello es que labure otro que yo soy mas vivo y han llegado donde estan, que este tio es un flipado pero lo pueden usar para meter en redil a estos zanganos, siempre han esperado que le solucionen el problema otros desde fuera y ellos la del laburo no se la conocen, aqui tenemos la picaresca alli el atraco a mano armada.
[#1](c1#c-1) Lo dudo, aprovechara para montar un enemigo en común...
Me da a mi que va a seguir la lista al dedillo.
https://www.altaveu.com/opinio/los-11-principios-de-la-propaganda-nazi-de-joseph-goebbels_1597_102.html
[#2](c2#c-2) También se acaba el considerar delito dejar de pagar a un trabajador o imponerle condiciones inseguras en su puesto de trabajo.
[#2](c2#c-2) en el siglo XIX tú serías de los que criticaban las luchas obreras por la jornada de 8 horas, por ejemplo. Así de patético suenas
[#7](c7#c-7) Hipotesis absurdas para adjudicarme tus delirios...
A mi la lucha obrera me parece bien pero que la paguen los afiliados del sindicato y que respeten la ley y el derecho a trabajar del resto de personas. Yo no tengo porque pagarle ni las mariscadas ni los sueldazos a los sindicalistas.

author: Test Author
title: AO Research Institute Davos’ Sibylle Grad awarded title of “Professor” at ETH Zurich
text:
AO Research Institute Davos’ Sibylle Grad awarded title of “Professor” at ETH Zurich
ARI’s
Grad obtained her degree in Pharmacy and her PhD in Natural Sciences from the Department of Cell Biology of ETH Zurich (Federal Institute of Technology). After completing her first post-doctoral training she joined AO Research Institute Davos in 2000. She has since then acquired extensive research expertise in the field of tissue engineering and regenerative medicine with focus on articular cartilage and intervertebral disc repair and regeneration. In 2018, she obtained her habilitation in Biomedical Engineering from the Department of Health Sciences and Technology at ETH Zurich.
The newly appointed Prof Grad said: “I’m very honored to receive this professorship. It is an important recognition of my contributions to research and education at a translational academic level. It is also a great motivation for me to continue teaching at ETH and to continue with my translational research activities at ARI. This is a big step for me because it means better integration in the Department of Health Sciences and Technology, closer collaborations with the professors of the department, better visibility, and better access to the facilities of ETH. I want to thank my colleagues at ARI, especially Geoff Richards, Mauro Alini, and Martin Stoddart, for their support, and I would like to thank my mentor at ETH, Prof Viola Vogel, and all professors at the Institute for Biomechanics for the long-lasting collaborations. I am very much looking forward to this new role.”
[Sibylle Grad](https://www.aofoundation.org/who-we-are/about-ao/news/2021/access_role-modelling_sibylle_grad), currently a Private Lecturer at ETH Zurich, has been[announced](https://www.admin.ch/gov/en/start/documentation/media-releases.msg-id-103437.html)by her alma mater as an Adjunct Professor in the Department of Health Sciences and Technology. She has been working at ARI for almost 25 years and is a Principal Scientist in the Regenerative Orthopaedics Program. Within the Regenerative Orthopaedics Program, she is the Focus Area Leader for Intervertebral Disc and Cartilage Biology.Grad obtained her degree in Pharmacy and her PhD in Natural Sciences from the Department of Cell Biology of ETH Zurich (Federal Institute of Technology). After completing her first post-doctoral training she joined AO Research Institute Davos in 2000. She has since then acquired extensive research expertise in the field of tissue engineering and regenerative medicine with focus on articular cartilage and intervertebral disc repair and regeneration. In 2018, she obtained her habilitation in Biomedical Engineering from the Department of Health Sciences and Technology at ETH Zurich.
The newly appointed Prof Grad said: “I’m very honored to receive this professorship. It is an important recognition of my contributions to research and education at a translational academic level. It is also a great motivation for me to continue teaching at ETH and to continue with my translational research activities at ARI. This is a big step for me because it means better integration in the Department of Health Sciences and Technology, closer collaborations with the professors of the department, better visibility, and better access to the facilities of ETH. I want to thank my colleagues at ARI, especially Geoff Richards, Mauro Alini, and Martin Stoddart, for their support, and I would like to thank my mentor at ETH, Prof Viola Vogel, and all professors at the Institute for Biomechanics for the long-lasting collaborations. I am very much looking forward to this new role.”

author: shendi veli
title: Le trappole e gli inganni di Netanyahu
text:
[Commenti](/sezioni/commenti)
Le trappole e gli inganni di Netanyahu
Di cessate il fuoco tra Israele e Hezbollah da parte di Tel Aviv non se ne parla neppure. «Andremo avanti fino il vittoria», dice Netanyahu che non teme di certo […]
Di cessate il fuoco tra Israele e Hezbollah da parte di Tel Aviv non se ne parla neppure. «Andremo avanti fino il vittoria», dice Netanyahu che non teme di certo […]
[Edizione del 27 settembre 2024](/edizioni/il-manifesto/il-manifesto-del-27-09-2024)
Di cessate il fuoco tra Israele e Hezbollah da parte di Tel Aviv non se ne parla neppure. «Andremo avanti fino il vittoria», dice Netanyahu che non teme di certo l’ira di Biden ma casomai del suo ministro della sicurezza Itamar Ben Gvir.
Che è il capo del partito di estrema destra Otzma Yehudit, che ieri ha minacciato di lasciare il governo – e quindi di farlo cadere – se il premier israeliano accettasse la proposta di cessate il fuoco americana e francese.
Primo dilemma risolto: la pace può attendere. L’obiettivo primario di Netanyahu, che oggi parla alle Nazioni Unite, è restare al potere a qualunque costo proseguendo il conflitto a Gaza e quello contro Hezbollah e il Libano. Lo farà con questa coalizione di sionisti radicali fino a quando potrà: nei suoi piani c’è quello di aspettare l’insediamento del prossimo presidente americano, nel gennaio 2025. Il massacro di Hamas del 7 ottobre 2023 gli ha consentito di proseguire la sua carriera politica e di sfuggire alla giustizia, oltre ogni previsione.
In tutto questo non solo sta trascinando Israele e il Medio Oriente verso un conflitto più ampio ma ha gettato il discredito sull’amministrazione americana rimandando indietro più volte, con ogni scusa possibile, il piano Biden per una tregua. Il segretario di stato Blinken è stato trattato da lui come un postino, tanto è vero che qualche giorno fa ha lasciato la regione alla svelta. In questo frangente si è avuta un’altra conferma di chi decide davvero tra Tel Aviv e Washington.
Bisogna essere chiari: gli Usa, come avviene da anni, sono i suoi complici più importanti. Il 23 agosto scorso hanno deciso di dare a Tel Aviv altri 20 miliardi di dollari di aiuti militari tra cui 50 caccia bombardieri F-15. E si deve essere ancora più espliciti: tra il suo preferito Trump – colui che ha riconosciuto la sovranità israeliana sul Golan e spostato l’ambasciata Usa a Gerusalemme – e la democratica Kamala Harris, attuale vicepresidente, per Netanyahu non c’è troppa differenza.
L’amministrazione democratica ha soddisfatto tutte le richieste di aiuti militari, ha accettato l’espansione delle colonie in Cisgiordania (con flebili proteste) e ha lasciato che decine di migliaia di coloni venissero armati dall’ esercito israeliano come ammesso dallo stesso capo dello Shin Bet. Quanto al Libano la mediazione Usa tra Israele e Hezbollah si è materializzata nel nominare come “inviato di pace” Amos Hochstein, cittadino Usa ma ex ufficiale dell’esercito israeliano, che questa stessa amministrazione aveva in precedenza incaricato nel 2021 di far saltare (diplomaticamente) il gasdotto North Stream tra Russia e Germania (sabotato come poi è stato nei fatti). Ogni commento è superfluo: con Hochstein è come avere messo la volpe nel pollaio.
Secondo dilemma di Netanyahu: far ritornare 60mila israeliani nei villaggi dell’Alta Galilea e l’invasione di terra del Libano. Israele ha invaso il Libano nel 1978 e nel 1982, poi ha lasciato nel 2000 la “fascia di sicurezza” in Libano e il confine è tracciato dalla Linea Blu dove ci sono i soldati Onu della missione Unifil (tra questi 1000 italiani). Con la guerra del 2006 tra Israele e Hezbollah Israele ha riprovato a penetrare in Libano ma nonostante 28 giorni di bombardamenti devastanti sul Paese dei cedri le truppe ebraiche sono state fermate sulla linea di Bint Jabayl.
Per far rientrare i profughi israeliani al Nord i comandi israeliani puntano sull’arretramento di Hezbollah e della sua artiglieria oltre il fiume Litani. L’invasione di terra avrebbe questo obiettivo. Ma non è detto che funzioni. In primo luogo Hezbollah è un’organizzazione di guerriglia addestrata e sperimentata (Siria, Iraq, Yemen) e le truppe israeliane potrebbero restare impantanate. In secondo luogo i bombardamenti israeliani di questi giorni hanno prodotto centinaia di migliaia di profughi fuggiti verso Beirut, la valle della Bekaa e anche verso la Siria. Lo scenario sta diventando sempre più drammatico e complicato.
Il Libano conta poco più di cinque milioni di abitanti, i profughi, in gran parte dalla Siria, sono 1,5 milioni, in pratica una persona su quattro è un rifugiato (i palestinesi sono 400mila): un’invasione massiccia significa combattere in un enorme campo profughi. Si può delineare un catastrofe militare e politica. Per questo anche gli esperti israeliani parlano di operazioni di terra “mirate” ma ripetute.
E veniamo al terzo dilemma di Netanyahu che è anche il nostro. Il premier oggi davanti all’Onu, come ha fatto in tutti questi vent’anni al potere, ribadirà che il vero nemico è l’Iran. Il premier sta provando in ogni modo a far entrare Teheran in un conflitto diretto con Israele in modo da provocare l’intervento degli Stati uniti a fianco dello stato ebraico. E un intervento americano significa anche la mobilitazione degli alleati degli Usa fuori e dentro la regione.
È la “grande guerra” che sognano i più estremisti dei sionisti per regolare i conti in Medio Oriente. Ma come dimostra anche il recente passato non solo nessun conflitto ha risolto i problemi della regione ma al contrario ha aperto il vaso di Pandora del caos e della distruzione (Afghanistan, Iraq, Siria, Libia). La “grande guerra” si deciderà, forse, con l’uscita di scena di Biden, un addio che in Medio Oriente non lascia rimpianti ma neppure molte speranze.
I consigli di mema
Gli articoli dall'Archivio per approfondire questo argomento

author: Lethbridge Herald
title: Estate of Tupac Shakur sends cease-and-desist letter to Drake over AI vocals
text:
By The Canadian Press on April 25, 2024.
A lawyer representing the estate of Tupac Shakur has sent a cease and desist letter to Drake after he used an AI-generated likeness of the late rapper’s voice in a diss track.
Howard King says in the letter that “Taylor Made Freestyle” is a “flagrant violation of Tupac’s publicity and the estate’s legal rights,” and if Drake fails to remove the track from the platforms where it’s available, the estate will consider suing.
Drake, born Aubrey Graham, dropped the track last week as part of an ongoing spat with rapper Kendrick Lamar, who last month suggested that the Toronto rapper isn’t on his level.
King calls Drake’s use of a facsimile of Shakur’s voice “a blatant abuse of the legacy of one of the greatest hip-hop artists of all time,” in part because Drake used it to diss Lamar, “who has given nothing but respect to Tupac and his legacy.”
King claims in the letter that Drake “used the same California laws that you knowingly violated with your AI sound-alike” to challenge a business’s website that used an image of Drake without his consent.
King claims the use of Drake’s image in that case was “much less publicized and far more benign.”
This report by The Canadian Press was first published April 25, 2024.
